scenarioDescription:
The HD 106906 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 106906 is a star with 1.5 times the mass of the Sun, and 2.12 times its radius. It is located 336.04 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.013 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 106906 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 106906 system


HD 106906 b

HD 106906 b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory, in 2014-01, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 650.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 106906 b is 3498.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 106906 b is 12.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 106906 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 106906, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory.
name: HD 106906 - System With 1 Exoplanet
